react-questions.question: What is React primarily used for?
react-questions.description: React is mainly used for building user interfaces in web applications.

react-questions.question: Which company developed React?
react-questions.description: React was developed by Meta (formerly Facebook) and released in 2013.

react-questions.question: What hook lets you manage state?
react-questions.description: The useState hook allows functional components to manage state.

react-questions.question: What returns JSX in React?
react-questions.description: Components in React return JSX which is rendered to the UI.

react-questions.question: Which symbol is used for fragments?
react-questions.description: React fragments use the <> </> syntax to group elements without adding extra nodes.

react-questions.question: Which hook runs after rendering?
react-questions.description: useEffect runs after the component renders and is commonly used for side effects like fetching data.

react-questions.question: JSX stands for?
react-questions.description: JSX stands for JavaScript XML, a syntax extension used in React to write HTML-like code.

react-questions.question: Which file contains routes in React Router?
react-questions.description: Routes are usually defined inside App.js using React Router.

react-questions.question: React is a...
react-questions.description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, not a full framework.

react-questions.question: useRef is used for...
react-questions.description: useRef provides a way to access and interact with DOM elements directly.

react-questions.question: Which keyword is used to export a component?
react-questions.description: In ES modules, 'export' is used to make a component available for import in other files.

react-questions.question: What is the first method called in class component?
react-questions.description: The constructor is the first method called when a class component is created.

react-questions.question: State is...
react-questions.description: State in React is mutable, meaning it can change over time and cause re-renders.

react-questions.question: Props are...
react-questions.description: Props are read-only and passed from parent to child components.

react-questions.question: What updates the UI in React?
react-questions.description: When state changes, React re-renders the component to reflect the updated UI.

react-questions.question: What creates virtual DOM?
react-questions.description: React creates and maintains a virtual DOM to optimize UI rendering.

react-questions.question: Which hook handles side effects?
react-questions.description: useEffect is used to perform side effects like API calls, DOM updates, and timers.

react-questions.question: React Router enables...
react-questions.description: React Router is a library that handles navigation and routing in React apps.

react-questions.question: Which keyword is used to create a function component?
react-questions.description: Function components are defined using the 'function' keyword in JavaScript.

react-questions.question: JSX must return a...
react-questions.description: JSX must return a single parent element, which can contain multiple child elements.

javascript-questions.question: Which keyword declares a variable in JavaScript?
javascript-questions.description: JavaScript supports 'var', 'let', and 'const' for declaring variables, with 'let' being block-scoped.

javascript-questions.question: What is the output of `typeof null`?
javascript-questions.description: `typeof null` is a long-standing bug in JavaScript â€” it returns 'object'.

javascript-questions.question: Which symbol is used for comments in JavaScript?
javascript-questions.description: Single-line comments use `//`, while block comments use `/* */`.

javascript-questions.question: Which method converts JSON text to JavaScript object?
javascript-questions.description: `JSON.parse()` is used to convert a JSON string into a JavaScript object.

javascript-questions.question: What does `NaN` stand for?
javascript-questions.description: NaN means 'Not a Number', and it's returned when math operations fail.

html-questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
html-questions.description: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language and is used to structure web content.

html-questions.question: Which tag is used for inserting images?
html-questions.description: The `` tag is used to embed images in an HTML page.

html-questions.question: Which tag creates a line break?
html-questions.description:
The `
` tag inserts a single line break without needing a closing tag.

html-questions.question: Which tag defines a hyperlink?
html-questions.description: `<a>` is used for links, with the `href` attribute pointing to the destination.

html-questions.question: Which element contains metadata about the document?
html-questions.description: The `<head>` tag contains metadata like title, charset, and linked resources.

css-questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
css-questions.description: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets and is used to style HTML elements.

css-questions.question: Which symbol is used to select an ID in CSS?
css-questions.description: `#id` is the syntax to select an element by its ID in CSS.

css-questions.question: Which property changes text color?
css-questions.description: The `color` property changes the color of the text.

css-questions.question: Which CSS position makes an element follow scroll?
css-questions.description: Sticky elements stay within the viewport after crossing a threshold while scrolling.

css-questions.question:
How do you select all `

` elements inside a `

`?
css-questions.description:
`div p` selects all `

` tags that are descendants of a `

`.
